title: Brecon Beacons Family Weekend
tagline: Caves, bikes, and gentle peaks for little legs
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8+ who enjoy gentle outdoor activities. Children should be comfortable with short walks and bike rides.
notSuitableFor: Families looking for extreme sports or very challenging hikes. Those with mobility issues may find some activities difficult.

stops.title: Dan yr Ogof Caves
stops.description: Explore the fascinating Dan yr Ogof cave system, a series of stunning underground caverns with impressive rock formations and waterfalls.

wetAlt.title: Craig y Nos Castle Tour
wetAlt.description: Take a guided tour of Craig y Nos Castle, a historic Victorian castle with a rich history and beautiful architecture.

budgetAlt.title: Penycae Community Park
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free visit to a local community park with play areas and green spaces.

stops.title: The Old White Horse Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub serving classic pub fare and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Craig y Nos Country Park
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches overlooking the scenic Craig y Nos Castle

stops.title: BikePark Wales (Family Trails)
stops.description: Rent bikes and enjoy a family-friendly ride on the easier trails at BikePark Wales, with graded routes suitable for beginners and younger riders.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Cafe & Skills Area
wetAlt.description: Enjoy time in the cafe with views of the trails, with a pump track, skills area and bike shop for browsing.

budgetAlt.title: Taff Trail Cycle (Free)
budgetAlt.description: Cycle a section of the Taff Trail, a scenic and mostly flat path following the River Taff. Bring your own bikes or rent them locally.

stops.title: Premier Inn Merthyr Tydfil
stops.description: A reliable and comfortable hotel option with family rooms, located close to BikePark Wales and local amenities.

budgetAlt.title: Grawen Camping
budgetAlt.description: A campsite near Merthyr Tydfil, offering a budget-friendly option for families who enjoy camping.

stops.title: Pen y Fan Hike (Pony Path)
stops.description: An easy and popular route to the summit of Pen y Fan, the highest peak in South Wales, offering stunning panoramic views (allow 2-3 hours).

wetAlt.title: Brecon Mountain Railway
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic steam train ride through the Brecon Beacons, offering views of the mountains and valleys.

budgetAlt.title: Lower Neuadd Reservoir Walk
budgetAlt.description: A scenic and accessible walk around the Lower Neuadd Reservoir, suitable for all ages and abilities.

stops.title: Storey Arms Cafe
stops.description: A convenient cafe at the base of Pen y Fan, offering sandwiches, snacks, and hot drinks.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Pen y Fan summit

stops.title: Llangorse Lake Paddle Boarding
stops.description: Enjoy a relaxing paddle boarding session on the tranquil Llangorse Lake, with options for beginners and experienced paddlers. (seasonal)

wetAlt.title: Llangorse Multi Activity Centre
wetAlt.description: Indoor climbing, play barn and cafe

budgetAlt.title: Llangorse Lake Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free walk along the shores of Llangorse Lake, taking in the scenic views and spotting local wildlife.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The Brecon Beacons can experience unpredictable weather, even in summer. Be prepared for rain and wind, especially on higher ground. Check the forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends, especially during school holidays. Allow extra time for travel, particularly on the A470. Parking at Pen y Fan (Storey Arms) fills up quickly; arrive early or consider using public transport.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is highly recommended for BikePark Wales, Dan yr Ogof Caves, and Llangorse Lake paddle boarding, especially during peak season.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary is designed for families with a reasonable level of fitness. The Pen y Fan hike is relatively easy, but it is still a climb. Mountain biking is on beginner-friendly trails.
